title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 600.11 - Noncompliance with federal and state equal opportunity requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 600.11 - Noncompliance with federal and state equal opportunity requirements

State Regulations
A pattern or practice of noncompliance by a sponsor (or
where the sponsor is a joint apprenticeship committee, by one of the parties
represented on such committee) with Federal or State laws or regulations
requiring equal opportunity may be grounds for the imposition of sanctions in
accordance with section
600.14
of this Part if such
noncompliance is related to the equal employment opportunity of apprentices
and/or graduates of such an apprenticeship program under this Part. The sponsor
shall take affirmative steps to assist and cooperate with employers and unions
in fulfilling their equal employment opportunity obligations. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
600.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
